title: Python Basics

workshops.title: FizzBuzz
workshops.prompt: Write a function fizzbuzz(n) that returns a list of strings for numbers 1 to n. For multiples of 3, use 'Fizz'. For multiples of 5, use 'Buzz'. For multiples of both, use 'FizzBuzz'. Otherwise, use the number as a string.

approaches.title: If-Elif Chain
hints: Hint 1: Check divisibility by 15 first (both 3 and 5) to get 'FizzBuzz'.
Hint 2: Use elif for divisibility by 3, then by 5.
Hint 3: Convert numbers to strings with str(i) in the else clause.
